private_information: You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
You cannot move disks F, G, H, I, J.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time, move only the top disk of a peg, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to transform the initial configuration into the goal configuration while respecting the agent move restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: You may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
You cannot move disks A, B, C, D, E.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time, move only the top disk of a peg, and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to transform the initial configuration into the goal configuration while respecting the agent move restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: You are responsible for auditing temporal and causal consistency across all proposed moves.
You must remove bookkeeping shortcuts and prohibit any post-hoc penalties or quota-token style allowances; only physically realizable sequences are valid.
You must verify that each step moves a single topmost disk, never places a larger disk on a smaller one, and respects the per-agent disk permissions.
auditor.goal: Verify, clean, and, if necessary, correct the combined move list so it is a valid Tower of Hanoi execution that achieves the stated goal.

private_information: Coordinate the agents, integrate proposals, and finalize a correct global plan.
Produce a correct PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent proposals into a single valid, temporally and causally consistent plan that achieves the goal configuration, and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver.

init.move_format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2

public_information: Two-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle is empty; right is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom D, F, G, H, I, J; middle is empty; right peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, E.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 can move only disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; move only the top disk of a peg; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
reference_plan: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk E from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk D from middle to left

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_1, responsible for planning legal moves for disks A, B, C, D, E only; obey Hanoi rules, produce a strictly ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2', avoid PDDL and avoid non-causal shortcuts.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Propose a concrete ordered sequence of your moves only (A-E) that helps reach the goal; do not include moves of F-J and do not emit PDDL.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_2, responsible for planning legal moves for disks F, G, H, I, J only; obey Hanoi rules, produce a strictly ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' if any moves are required; avoid PDDL and avoid non-causal shortcuts.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Propose only the moves you must perform (if any) on disks F-J to achieve the goal; if no moves are needed, return an empty ordered list; do not emit PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor; merge and audit the proposed move lists, verifying temporal and causal consistency with Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions; remove bookkeeping shortcuts and any post-hoc penalties; output a single cleaned ordered list in the required move format that achieves the goal or clearly state conflicts if impossible.
audit.prompt: You receive candidate moves: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and the initial and goal stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks} and {environment->init->goal_stacks}, verify that only one top disk moves at each step, no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller one, and that agent permissions are respected. Return a single ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner; integrate the audited move sequence and produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver (Fast Downward), using classical STRIPS-style PDDL; enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem in <problem></problem>; ensure object and predicate definitions capture pegs, disks, smaller-than ordering, on/clear relations, and initial and goal states as specified.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the validated moves {audited_moves} along with any agent proposals {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that models the 3-peg, 10-disk Tower of Hanoi with the given initial and goal configurations from {environment->init->initial_stacks} and {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Ensure actions enforce legality (top-only moves, no larger on smaller) and include the full 'smaller' ordering over disks A-J. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
